newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Africa Israel board approves insurance spin-off.
newsitem.headline: Africa Israel board approves insurance spin-off.

text.p: The board of directors of Africa Israel Investments said they approved the spin-off of Leumi Insurance Holdings by distributing a dividend in kind to shareholders.
Africa Israel shareholders will receive shares in Leumi Insurance, the parent of company of Migdal Insurance, and Leumi Insurance will be listed on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange.
The board of directors will call an extraordinary meeting of shareholders to approve the spin-off, a prerequisite for a deal that will enable Italian insurer Generali Spa to take control of Migdal.

Last month Bank Leumi, which owns 52 percent of Africa Israel, signed a letter of intent with Generali under which the Italian company agreed to make an offer to all Leumi Insurance shareholders following the spin-off to buy 40 percent of the shares they hold in Leumi Insurance.
The price will be based on a three billion shekel valuation of Migdal, Israel's largest insurance company.
Bank Leumi owns 27.72 percent of Leumi Insurance and Africa Israel holds 72.28 percent.
Leumi Insurance holds 68.1 percent of Migdal while Generali holds 27.1 percent and others hold 4.8 percent.
Last week the managing director of Africa Israel, Shlomo Grofman, resigned because of his opposition to the spin-off of the company's insurance holdings.

Leumi, which must reduce it holdings in Africa Israel to 25 percent by year's end to comply with Israeli banking law, believes it will get more money by spinning off the insurance holdings and selling them separately from Africa.
Trading in Africa Israel shares was suspended for most of Sunday pending an announcement regarding the board meeting. Trading will resume on Monday.
Africa Israel is one of Israel's largest conglomerates with holdings in the hotel, construction, tourism and real estate sectors as well as insurance.
